sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"电报"之意。
means: cable ： 通常指通过海底电缆打的电报，也可指广义的电报。
telegram ： 常用词，指通过电报系统发出的信息，尤指具体的一份份电报。
telegraph ： 侧重指通信方式和电报业各，不可数名词，表想象概念。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French chable, from late Latin capulum 'halter'

entry.def: A cable is a thick wire, or a group of wires inside a rubber or plastic covering, which is used to carry electricity or electronic signals.

example.ex: ...strings of coloured lights with weatherproof cable.
example.tran: 搭在防风雨的绝缘电线上的串串彩灯

entry.def: A cable is a kind of very strong, thick rope, made of wires twisted together.

example.ex: Steel cable will be used to replace worn ropes.
example.tran: 将用钢缆替换磨损的绳索。

entry.def: Cable is used to refer to television systems in which the signals are sent along underground wires rather than by radio waves.

example.ex: They ran commercials on cable systems across the country...
example.tran: 他们在全国的有线电视网上投放商业广告。

example.ex: The channel is only available on cable.
example.tran: 这个频道只有有线电视才能收看。

entry.def: A cable is the same as a telegram .

example.ex: She sent a cable to her mother.

entry.def: If you cable someone, you send them a message in the form of a telegram.

example.ex: 'Don't do it again,' Franklin cabled her when he got her letter...
example.tran: 富兰克林收到她的信后给她拍了封电报,说:“别再那么做了。”

example.ex: She had to decide whether or not to cable the news to Louis.
example.tran: 她得决定要不要将这个消息电告路易斯。

entry.def: If a country, a city, or someone's home is cabled, cables and other equipment are put in place so that the people there can receive cable television.

example.ex: In France, 27 major cities are soon to be cabled...
example.tran: 法国有27座大城市不久将安装有线电视。

example.ex: In the UK, 254,000 homes are cabled.
example.tran: 在英国,有254,000户住户安装了有线电视。

means.word_mean: 2. a conductor for transmitting electrical or optical signals or electric power
3. a very strong thick rope made of twisted hemp or steel wire
5. television that is transmitted over cable directly to the receiver
6. a television system transmitted over cables

means.word_mean: 给(某人)发电报, 打电报告诉(某人)

sentences.en: Don't forget to cable us as soon as you arrive.
sentences.cn: 别忘了一到就给我发个电报。

means.word_mean: 用锚链系住；用绳索缚住

sentences.en: Their fishing boats were cabled together before the storm came.
sentences.cn: 暴风雨降临前，他们的渔船都用缆绳系在一起。

means.word_mean: 用海底电报拍发(信息等)

sentences.en: They cabled the news to her family.
sentences.cn: 他们把这个消息电告她的家属。

sentences.en: Please write or cable as soon as you arrive.
sentences.cn: 请一到就给我们来封信或打个电报。

jushi.english: Send a cable to our overseas office.
jushi.chinese: 给我们的海外办事处发个电报。

jushi.english: The truck used a cable to tow the automobile.
The telephone company laid their cables beneath the streets.
jushi.chinese: 电话公司把电缆铺设在街道下面。
